title: Think About Audience Engagement
text: Consider what might catch the audience's attention and be clear about the main point of the data.

title: Specificity Matters
text: Titles that provide specific data points are often more engaging and informative. Think about what specific information would be most compelling to someone viewing the slide.

title: Focus on the Key Message
text: A good title conveys the central message that the data supports or illustrates. What is the main takeaway from the data being presented?

title: Effective Data Communication
text: Think about how the data can be interpreted by the audience. A straightforward title helps the audience quickly grasp the significance of the data.

title: Stay Objective
text: Ensure the title remains neutral and does not inherently contain bias or subjective views. The data should speak for itself.

title: Refining Title Selection
text: With all considerations in mind, choose a title that succinctly summarizes the data. It should be compelling yet accurate.
choices: Key findings in ice hockey research.
Ice hockey is the best sport ever.
